intro: Dubyaea lanceolata, commonly known as the narrowleaf dubyaea, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family, which includes many bulbous plants. The plant produces striking, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Dubyaea lanceolata is valued for its ornamental appeal and relatively low maintenance requirements.
